This statement asserts that if you apply a certain substance (fertilizer) to your lawn, it will result in a specific outcome (lush and green).

The conclusion is "If I fertilize the lawn and there is a drought, it will be lush and green." This statement asserts that if you apply the same substance (fertilizer) to your lawn while there is a drought, it will still result in the same outcome (lush and green).

The argument is logically valid because the conclusion logically follows from the premise. If the premise is true, then the conclusion must also be true. In this case, the premise is that fertilizing the lawn will make it lush and green, and the conclusion is that if you fertilize the lawn while there is a drought, it will still be lush and green. This argument is valid because the conclusion logically follows from the premise, and therefore it is a sound argument.
